pages:
STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 4, 2024
Tia M. Cobb
CALUMET CENTER
330 GLENDALE ST,
HIGHLAND PARK, MI, 48203-3277
Re: License #: CI820201008
SI #: 2025SIC0000004
Dear Ms. Cobb:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
*** This report contains quoted profanity***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000004
Special Investigation Intake Date: October 2, 2024
License #: CI820201008
Licensee Group Organization: Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services
Licensee Designee: Derrick R. McCree
Chief Administrator: Tia M. Cobb
Agency Name: CALUMET CENTER
Agency Address: 330 GLENDALE ST
HIGHLAND PARK, MI 48203-3277
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 08/24/2025
Capacity: 90

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Initial Allegation: Staff slapped youth who was attempting to
swallow a screw.
2

Additional Allegation 1: Youth was picked up and pushed
against the wall causing him to hit the left side of his head to hit
the wall.
Additional Allegation 2: Youth's clothing was pulled and ripped
off.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/3/2024. Youth A reported he was self-harming with an object
he found outside his bedroom and Staff 1 attempted to intervene.
Youth A reported Staff 1 picked him up and pushed him against
the wall causing Youth A’s left side of his head to hit the wall.
Youth A reported another staff was present however he did not
recall who, and that staff called for a supervisor to assist. Youth A
reported Staff 7 and Staff 4 arrived. Youth A reported staff tried to
“strip him and were aggressive”. Youth A reported after Staff 1
removed his clothing, Youth A attempted to hit Staff 1 and Staff 1
slapped him and put him on the ground. Youth A reported Staff 3,
Staff 4, and Staff 7 were present however only Staff 3 witnessed
Staff 1 slap him. Youth A reported Staff 7 and Staff 4 did not see
Youth A get slapped by Staff 1 as it occurred inside Youth A’s
bedroom, and they were outside the door. Youth A reported no
youth witnessed the slap. Youth A reported he fell to the ground
after Staff 1 slapped him and Staff 1 placed him in a restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024. Staff
1 reported he worked second shift on Youth A’s pod on 9/30/2024
and Youth A was having a rough day. Staff 1 reported Youth A
attempted to go out the door and was trying to self-harm with an
object, unknown specifically what. Staff 1 reported he and Staff 3
attempted to get the object from Youth A and Youth A began
punching Staff 3. Staff 1 reported he placed Youth A in “a proper
restraint”. Staff 1 was unable to recall the name of the restraint he
placed Youth A in, however reported it was a Handle with Care
technique. Staff 1 reported Staff 7 was called to the pod and put
Youth A in his room. Staff 1 reported that was all that occurred,
and he did not go into Youth A’s room. Staff 1 reported Youth A
was locked in his bedroom for suicide precaution. Staff 1 did not
know how long Youth A was in his bedroom on suicide precaution.
Staff 1 reported he did enter Youth A’s room to have Youth A’s
clothing removed for Youth A to be placed in a suicide gown.
Staff 1 reported he assisted Staff 7 in removing Youth A’s clothing
by holding Youth A while Staff 7 removed Youth A’s clothing.
Staff 1 reported he was holding Youth A in a standing restraint
and demonstrated a standing Handle with Care primary restraint
technique (PRT). Staff 1 reported Youth A kept getting out of the
3

restraint. Staff 1 reported once Youth A’s clothing was removed,
he and Staff 7 exited the bedroom. Staff 1 reported he was never
alone in the bedroom with Youth A as Staff 7 was in the room with
him. Staff 1 did not recall if Staff 3 was in the bedroom. Staff 1
reported Youth A was never in a supine restraint on the ground.
Staff 3 reported the facility does not allow supine restraints. Staff 1
reported he never picked Youth A up off the ground, no staff ever
pushed Youth A against the wall causing Youth A to hit his head.
Staff 1 reported he nor Staff 7 were aggressive while removing
Youth A’s clothing. Staff 1 did not recall any other staff that were
present during the incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024.
Staff 2 reported working on Youth A’s pod on 9/30/2024. Staff 2
reported Youth A was running around the pod and Staff 2
continuously had to redirect Youth A. Staff 2 requested a break
and returned from break to find Youth A sitting next to the control
room door. Staff 2 reported Youth A has a pattern of finding items
around the facility to self-harm with. Staff 2 reported Youth A was
sitting next to the control room with a sharp metal piece from a
pencil eraser. Staff 2 attempted to get the metal from Youth A and
Staff 1 assisted her. Staff 1 told Youth A to give him the metal.
Youth A tried to grab Staff 2’s walkie talkie off her pants. Staff 2
reported it was “blurry” as to what happened from there. Staff 2
reported what she could remember was Staff 1 tried to take the
metal from Youth A and Youth A had the walkie talkie in his hand.
Staff 3 came to assist. Staff 3 attempted to try to calm Youth A
down and Youth A started to punch Staff 3. Staff 1 attempted to
restrain Youth A and Youth A dropped to the ground and was
kicking his feet. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 and Staff 3 had Youth A’s
arms secured on the ground and attempted to get Youth A into a
standing position. Youth A was resisting Staff 1 and Staff 3
standing him up. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 and Staff 3 attempted to
pick Youth A up and described this as Staff 1 and Staff 3 holding
Youth A’s arms and one leg. Staff 2 reported she was not exactly
sure how Staff 1 and Staff 3 picked Youth A up or which staff was
where holding what. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 and Staff 3 moved
Youth A to his bedroom. Staff 3 reported she did not see what
happened once Staff 1 and Staff 3 were in the bedroom with
Youth A. Staff 2 reported she never saw Staff 1 or any staff slap
Youth A, or Youth A ever hit or get pushed against the wall. Staff
2 reported Youth A was resisting as Staff 1 and Staff 3 took him to
his bedroom. Staff 2 did not remember if Youth A hit his head on
the way to the bedroom. Staff 2 did not see Youth A go into the
suicide gown. Staff 2 reported she could not recall all the details of
4

the restraint she witnessed however it was per Handle with Care
Technique.
Staff 3 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024. Staff
3 reported he worked on Youth A’s pod on 9/30/2024 when Youth
A was attempting to self-harm. Youth A had a sharp item,
unknown specifically what, that he was cutting himself with. Staff
1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 approached Youth A to obtain the object he
was self-harming with. Youth A became “defensive” and punched
Staff 3 several times in the stomach and chest. Staff 3 reported
Staff 1 redirected Youth A’s body away from Staff 3 by securing
Youth A’s arms. Staff 3 reported the details were hard to recall.
Staff 3 recalled Youth A was secured by holding his arms and
leaning him forward. Staff 3 reported he believed it was a Handle
with Care technique as he described Youth A’s arms being in a
PRT and Youth A transitioning to the ground in a supine position.
Staff 3 reported Youth A ended up in room 1. Staff 3 reported
Youth A was a harm to himself and others, so he was placed in
the suicide monitoring room, room 1, that has a camera. Staff 3
reported Youth A was in room 1 and picked at the paint which had
a sharp edge that Youth A used to pick at an old scab. Staff 3
reported it was determined Youth A would go on suicide
precaution and would need to go into a suicide gown. Staff 3 did
not know who determined Youth A would go on suicide
precaution. Staff 1 and Staff 3 entered room 1 to remove Youth
A’s clothing for Youth A to go into a suicide gown while Staff 7
was in the doorway. Staff 3 reported Youth A was not willing to go
into the suicide gown and began to hit him and kicked him in the
mouth, and punch Staff 1. Staff 3 reported he never saw Staff 1
slap Youth A while they were in room 1 with Youth A. Staff 3
reported at no time was Staff 1 in room 1 alone with Youth A as
Staff 3 was present in the room with Staff 1 and Staff 7 was in the
doorway the entire time. Staff 3 reported Youth A swung to punch
Staff 1 and Staff 1 dodged the punch by moving. Staff 3 reported
Staff 1 never picked Youth A up in the pod area or in room 1.
Staff 3 reported Staff 1 nor any staff ever pushed or moved Youth
A against the wall where Youth A would have hit his head. Staff 3
reported he and Staff 1 were not “aggressive” when removing
Youth A’s clothing for Youth A to go into the suicide gown. Staff 3
reported he and Staff 1 were “only as aggressive as needed to be”
and explained this as if a youth needs to go into a suicide gown
and the youth is kicking and punching, staff have to “muscle” to
get the youth’s clothing off. Staff 3 reported “muscle” means
“grabbing legs” to stop Youth A from kicking and holding arms to
stop from punching. Staff 3 reported “it is not meant to harm the
5

youth, just to get the job done.” Staff 3 reported Youth A was not
restrained in room 1. Staff 3 has no concerns with Staff 1.
Staff 4 was attempted to be interviewed via telephone on
10/28/2024 and 10/29/2024 as Staff 4 is no longer employed at
the facility. The phone number provided by the facility for Staff 4
is no longer in service.
Facility Manager was interviewed via teams meeting on
10/24/2024. Facility Manager reported she was training a new
staff and entered the pod and Youth A was in his bedroom.
Facility Manager reported she is supposed to know/be informed
when youth are placed in their bedrooms. Facility Manager
reported she started asking questions as to why Youth A was in
his bedroom and was informed, he was placed on suicide
precaution. Facility Manager reported she went to check on Youth
A and he was yelling in the bedroom and swearing however she
ensured he was safe. Facility Manager reported she went to
review video footage to ensure the restraint was performed
properly. Facility Manager reported she reviewed the video
footage and per the video she reviewed Youth A was by the door
next to his room and Staff 2 walked over to talk to him. Youth A
was doing something to his arm. Staff 2 attempted to get an
object from Youth A. Youth A went behind Staff 2 on the floor and
Staff 3 walked over to assist. Staff 1 then came to assist. Youth A
began punching Staff 3. Staff 3 was blocking the punches. Staff 1
approached Youth A from behind and placed him in a restraint.
Facility Manager reported Staff 1 had Youth A in a proper standing
PRT. Staff 7 and Staff 4 arrived on the pod. Staff 7 took over for
Staff 1 in the PRT and placed Youth A in his room. Facility
Manager reported Youth A was never on the ground in a supine
restraint. Staff 4 got a suicide gown. Staff 1, Staff 3, and Staff 7
entered Youth A’s bedroom and clothing could be seen being
thrown out of the door. Facility Manager reported only safety
support coordinators and managers at the facility can make the
decision for a youth to go into seclusion in their bedrooms. Facility
Manager reported if she is not physically present during the
incident that she is to be notified immediately of the situation.
Facility Manager reported she was not notified of the incident as
she is supposed to be. Facility Manager did not recall how long
Youth A had been in his bedroom prior to her entering the pod and
finding him in his bedroom. Facility Manager reported Staff 4
placed Youth A on suicide precaution. Facility Manager reported
the clinical case managers are supposed to be the individuals to
determine if suicide precaution is needed. Facility Manager
reported staff did not follow the policy and procedure for placing a
6

youth on suicide precaution and expressed that she did not think
the staff were aware that there was a procedure that needed to be
followed. Facility Manager reported she never saw on video
footage review where Staff 1 allegedly slapped Youth A. Facility
Manager reported her only concern with reviewing the video
footage was she was not notified of the incident. Facility Manager
reported Staff 7 informed her the following day that Youth A was
alleging Staff 1 slapped him.
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on 10/28/2024. Staff 7
reported he was called to assist with Youth A. Staff 7 reported
when he arrived on the pod Youth A was in a standing PRT
restraint with Staff 1. Staff 7 reported he told Staff 1 to release
Youth A from the restraint as the PRT is a Handle with Care
technique and the facility had transitioned to MANDT restraint
technique on 9/30/2024. Staff 7 reported after Staff 1 released
Youth A from the restraint, Staff 7 put his arm around Youth A’s
shoulders and walked Youth A to his bedroom. Staff 1 and Staff 3
followed. Youth A tried to hit and kick Staff 1 and Staff 3. Staff 7,
Staff 1, and Staff 3 enter Youth A’s room with a suicide gown.
Staff 7 reported Staff 4 told him Facility Manager said for Youth A
to go on suicide precaution. Staff 7 reported he stood in Youth A’s
doorway while Staff 1 and Staff 3 removed Youth A’s clothing.
Staff 7 reported Staff 1 and Staff 3 removed Youth A’s clothing as
they should however Youth A was refusing to allow his clothes to
be removed. Staff 7 reported he felt Staff 3 could have been
better about removing the clothing and explained Staff 3 was
pulling the jumper off Youth A which caused the jumper to rip and
Staff 3 just continued to rip it off Youth A. Staff 7 reported “it
looked forceful” when Staff 1 and Staff 3 were removing Youth A’s
clothing however Youth A was refusing to take his clothes off.
After Staff 1 and Staff 3 removed Youth A’s clothing, Youth A was
provided a suicide gown and Staff 7, Staff 1, and Staff 3 exited the
room. Staff 7 reported he was talking to Youth A through the door
and Youth A alleged Staff 1 slapped him during the incident. Staff
7 reported he never saw Staff 1 slap Youth A. Youth A tried to
punch Staff 1 and Staff 1 moved to avoid the hit and Youth A fell
to the ground. Staff 7 reported Youth A was not restrained in his
bedroom. Youth A was held to get his jumper off him. Staff 7
explained “held” as Staff 1 and Staff 3 holding Youth A’s arms and
shoulders, and Youth A was leaning against Staff 1 and Staff 3 as
they removed his clothing. Staff 7 reported he did not know if there
was a policy or what staff are supposed to do when youth are
refusing to allow their clothing to be taken off.
7

Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on
10/28/2024. Chief Administrator reported she did not review the
video footage of the incident that she could recall. Chief
Administrator reported she had minimal information regarding the
incident as Operations Manager is currently overseeing the facility
as facility is attempting to hire a new director. Chief Administrator
reported the information she had was Youth A had a screw and
staff were able to obtain the screw from Youth A and Staff 1 did
not slap Youth A.
Operations Manager was interviewed via telephone on
10/28/2024. Operations Manager reported he reviewed the
incident via video footage after it was alleged Staff 1 slapped
Youth A. Operations Manager reported from what he could recall
from his video review Youth A was restrained by Staff 1, Staff 3,
and Staff 7. Operations Manager reported “it was a clean
restraint”. Operations Manager reported Youth A had something.
Staff1, Staff 2, and Staff 7 went to get it from him, restrained
Youth A, and Youth A dropped to the ground. Staff 1 immediately
disengaged from the restraint when Youth A dropped to the
ground. Youth A began trying to punch Staff 1 and Staff 1 left the
area. Operations Manager reported he and Facility Manager
talked to Youth A on 10/1/2024 after hearing the allegations Youth
A made about being slapped. Operations Manager reported
Youth A changed his story two to three times. Operations
Manager informed Youth A after Youth A had changed his story
that the video was reviewed. Youth A did not have anything to say
after learning video camera footage had been reviewed.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 9/30/2024 was unable to be reviewed as the
facility reported a power outage occurred resulting in the server
being knocked out and no video footage for the month of
September being able to be obtained to review.
Documents Reviewed:
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Unusual Incident
Report Summary dated 9/30/2024 for Youth A: Staff 1
placed Youth A in a two-arm hold for two minutes and
twenty seconds. Staff 7 arrived and placed Youth A in his
room to counsel him. Youth A began peeling paint off the
floor and sticking it into his arm. Staff 1 removed all Youth
A’s clothing while staff got a turtle suit.
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Behavior Management
System, Behavioral Intervention Techniques, Safe Physical
8

Intervention (Youth Restraint) Policy: Only the approved
SJJS safe physical management techniques may be used.
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Suicide Precaution
Policy: Use suicide blankets and gowns for all youth placed
on Suicide Precautions during sleeping hours and anytime
they are in their room.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed professional boundaries training on
6/28/204 and 7/3/2024 and the facilities policies and
procedures training 7/5/2024.
Analysis Initial Allegation: Staff 1 slapped Youth A
The facility is found in compliance as Staff 3, Staff 1, and Staff 7
reported being present and Staff 1 did not slap Youth A. There is
no video footage to be reviewed and no injury to Youth A.
Additional Allegation 1: Youth was picked up and pushed
against the wall causing him to hit the left side of his head to
hit the wall.
The facility is found in compliance as Youth A is the only person
reporting he was pushed against the wall causing him to hit the
left side of his head on the wall. Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were
the three staff on the pod from the onsite of the incident and all
reported Youth A was not pushed against a wall, nor did he hit his
head. Additionally, Facility Manager and Operations Manager
reported they reviewed the video and did not see this occur.
Additional Allegation 2: Youth A’s clothing was pulled and
ripped off him
The facility is found in noncompliance as per interviews with Youth
A, Staff 3, and Staff 7, Youth A’s clothing was pulled hard enough
off of his body to cause the clothing to rip and Staff 3 continued to
then rip the clothing off Youth A.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered for the facility to implement a
policy/process for removing youths clothing and how staff are
expected to remove youths clothing in a safe and appropriate
manner.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2024SIC0001229 dated 9/13/2024, CAP pending approval
9

Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Title restraints; elimination of restraints
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was restrained not per technique.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/3/2024. Youth A did not report any information or concerns
regarding restraints. Youth A only reported Staff 1 picked him up
and pushed him against the wall causing Youth A’s left side of his
head to hit the wall.
Staff 1 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024. Staff
1 reported he placed Youth A in “a proper restraint” on the pod.
Staff 1 was unable to recall the name of the restraint he placed
Youth A in, however reported it was a Handle with Care
technique.
Staff 1 reported once inside Youth A’s bedroom he was holding
Youth A in a standing restraint while removing Youth A’s clothing
and demonstrated a standing Handle with Care primary restraint
technique (PRT). Staff 1 reported Youth A kept getting out of the
restraint while his clothing was being removed.
Staff 2 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 attempted to restrain Youth A on the pod
and Youth A dropped to the ground and was kicking his feet. Staff
2 reported Staff 1 and Staff 3 had Youth A’s arms secured on the
ground and attempted to get Youth A into a standing position.
Youth A was resisting Staff 1 and Staff 3 standing him up. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 and Staff 3 attempted to pick Youth A up and
described this as Staff 1 and Staff 3 holding Youth A’s arms and
one leg. Staff 2 reported she was not exactly sure how Staff 1
and Staff 3 picked Youth A up or which staff was where holding
what. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 and Staff 3 moved Youth A to his
bedroom.
10

Staff 2 reported she did not see anything that occurred in Youth
A’s bedroom.
Staff 3 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024. Staff
3 reported Staff 1 redirected Youth A’s body away from Staff 3 on
the pod by securing Youth A’s arms. Staff 3 reported the details
were hard to recall. Staff 3 reported all he could recall was Youth
A was secured by holding his arms and leaning him forward. Staff
3 reported he believed it was a Handle with Care technique as he
described Youth A’s arms being in a PRT and Youth A
transitioning to the ground in a supine position.
Staff 3 reported Youth A was not restrained in his bedroom.
Facility Manager was interviewed via teams on 10/24/2024.
Facility Manager was not present for the incident. Facility
Manager reviewed video footage after becoming aware however
was only able to view video footage of what occurred on the pod
as there are no video cameras in the bedrooms. Facility Manager
reported from what she recalled from reviewing video footage
Staff 1 approached Youth A from behind and placed him in a
standing PRT restraint. Facility Manager reported Staff 1 had
Youth A in a proper standing PRT restraint. Staff 7 and Staff 4
arrived on the pod. Staff 7 took over the restraint from Staff 1 and
walked Youth A in his bedroom. Facility Manager reported Youth
A was never on the ground in a supine restraint.
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on 10/28/2024. Staff 7
reported when he arrived on the pod Youth A was in a standing
PRT restraint with Staff 1. Staff 7 reported he told Staff 1 to
release Youth A from the restraint as it was not the MANDT
restraint technique and was a Handle with Care technique. Staff 7
reported the facility transitioned to MANDT restraint technique on
9/30/2024. Facility Manager reported Staff 1 had Youth A in a
proper PRT restraint per the prior model and he had no concerns
with the restraint other than the facility had transitioned to using
MANDT.
Staff 7 reported he supervised from the bedroom doorway while
Staff 1 and Staff 3 removed Youth A’s clothing. Staff 7 reported
Youth A was not restrained in his bedroom.
Training Manager was interviewed via teams on 10/24/2024
and provided email clarification on 11/6/2024. Training
Manager reported the facility transitioned from using Handle with
Care to using MANDT restraint model on 9/29/2024. Training
11

Manager reported the facility has never trained supine restraint
techniques at the facility including for when the facility used
Handle with Care and now with MANDT.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on
10/28/2024. Chief Administrator reported the facility has
transitioned to using MANDT restraint model. Chief Administrator
reported she believed the facility fully transitioned to MANDT on
9/30/2024 or 10/1/2024. Chief Administrator was unsure if a
memo or communication went out to staff regarding the only
restraint model to be used at the facility is MANDT.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 9/30/2024 was unable to be reviewed as the
facility reported a power outage occurred resulting in the server
being knocked out and no video footage for the month of
September being able to be obtained to review.
Documents Reviewed:
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Unusual Incident
Report Summary dated 9/30/2024 for Youth A: Staff 1
placed Youth A in a two-arm hold for two minutes and
twenty seconds. Staff 7 arrived and placed Youth A in his
room to counsel him. Youth A began peeling paint off the
floor and sticking it into his arm. Staff 1 removed all Youth
A’s clothing while staff got a turtle suit.
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Behavior Management
System, Behavioral Intervention Techniques, Safe Physical
Intervention (Youth Restraint) Policy: Physical Intervention
(Restraint) may only be used when a youth is in the act of
(1) harming self, (2) assaulting other persons, (3)
committing a serious act of destruction of property that
places the youth or others at a serious risk of injury, (4)
jeopardizing the safety of others or (5) jeopardizing the
security of himself (herself) or others. A youth picking up a
weapon will be interpreted as jeopardizing the safety and
security of self and others.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required Crisis Intervention
Physical training on 7/2/2024 and MANDT on 9/26/2024.
• Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 7, and Facility Manager personnel
files: Staff 2 received Handle with Care training 8/16/2024,
Staff 3 4/8/2024, Staff 7 3/21/2024, and Facility Manager
3/28/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there was not enough
information to support a rule violation.
12

Per interviews with Staff 7, Training Manager, and Chief
Administrator, it is unclear when the facility transitioned from
Handle with Care to utilizing MANDT restraint model as Staff 7
reported 9/30/2024, Training Manager reported 9/29/2024, and
Chief Administrator reported 9/30/2024 or 10/1/2024. Based on
these interviews, it is unclear what restraint model was to be
utilized on 9/30/2024.
Per interviews regarding the restraint on the pod, Staff 1, Staff 7,
and Facility Manager reported the restraint was a proper Handle
with Care PRT. Staff 7 was only concerned with the restraint as it
was a Handle with Care technique, and he reported the facility
had transitioned to MANDT restraint techniques. Staff 2 reported
Youth A dropped to the ground and Staff 1 and Staff 3 attempted
to get Youth A back into a standing position and picked Youth A
up. Staff 3 reported Youth A was in a supine restraint on the pod.
Per Training Manager, the facility has never trained supine
restraints for either Handle with Care or MANDT training model.
Facility Manager reported she reviewed video and Youth A was
never in a supine restraint.
Per interviews, Staff 1 reported securing Youth A in a PRT in
Youth A’s bedroom while removing Youth A’s clothing, however
Staff 3 and Staff 7 reported no restraint occurred in Youth A’s
bedroom. Based on this information, it is unclear if Youth A was
restrained in his bedroom as PA 116 defines restraint as
application of physical force without the use of a device, for the
purpose of restraining the free movement of a minor child's body.
Staff 1 described a restraint occurring however Staff 3 and Staff 7
report a restraint did not occur.
The facilities unusual incident report documents Staff 1 placed
Youth A in a two-arm hold and there is no documentation of any
type of restraint occurring in Youth A’s room while removing
clothing. There was no video footage to review.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered as follows:
• The facility update restraint policy to reflect MANDT and
current licensing rules to reflect CCI Licensing rule
400.4160 Emergency restraint.
• The facility educate staff that only approved MANDT
restraint model techniques can be used.
• The facility reeducate staff on PA 116 definition of restraint.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
13

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff made threats to youth through statements and sticking his
tongue out.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/3/2024. Youth A reported Staff 1 told him “I will slap the fuck
out of you” on a separate occasion as Staff 1 had heard Youth A
hit a female staff earlier in the shift. Youth A reported Staff 5 and
Staff 6 heard Staff 1 say this to him. Youth A reported this was the
first time a staff has slapped him or verbally threatened him at the
facility. Youth A reported Staff 1 “always” sticks his tongue out at
him when no one is around. Youth A reported Staff 1 has stuck
his tongue out at him “multiple times” since Youth A was taken off
suicide risk this week. Youth A reported no youth witnessed Staff
1 threatening him, or Staff 1 sticking his tongue out at him.
Staff 1 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024. Staff
1 denied ever sticking his tongue out at Youth A, saying “I will slap
the fuck out of you”, or Staff 3 ever laughing at Youth A during the
incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024.
Staff 2 reported she never saw Staff 3 laugh at Youth A during the
incident. Staff 2 reported she never heard Staff 1 tell Youth A “I
will slap the fuck out of you”. Staff 2 reported she has never seen
Staff 1 stick his tongue out at Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024. Staff
3 denied ever laughing at Youth A during the incident. Staff 3
reported he never heard Staff 1 say “I will slap the fuck out of
you”. Staff 3 has never seen Staff 1 stick his tongue out at Youth
A or any youth at the facility.
14

Staff 5 and Staff 6 were interviewed via teams meeting on
10/24/2024, separately. Staff 5 and Staff 6 reported they have
never heard Staff 1 tell Youth A “I will slap the fuck out of you”.
Staff 5 and Staff 6 have worked with Staff 1 and have no concerns
with Staff 1. Staff 5 and Staff 6 have never seen Staff 1 stick his
tongue out at any youth including Youth A.
Facility Manager was interviewed via teams meeting on
10/24/2024. Facility Manager reported she has never witnessed
Staff 1 stick his tongue out at Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Behavior Management
System, Behavioral Intervention Techniques Policy: use of
verbal and non-physical crisis intervention communication
intervention techniques will de-escalate the youth and
prevent the need for physical intervention; these
communication techniques include listening, supportive
communication, problem solving counseling, conflict
resolution counseling, appropriate attention to non-verbal
cues, attention to the use of physical space and active line
of sight supervision.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed professional boundaries training on
6/28/204 and 7/3/2024 and the facilities policies and
procedures training 7/5/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews no staff have
ever witnessed Staff 1 stick his tongue out at Youth A nor did Staff
5 or Staff 6 report hearing Staff 1 tell Youth A “I will slap the fuck
out of you” per Youth A’s allegation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
15

Allegation Facility did not follow internal suicide precaution policy.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/3/2024. Youth A reported he was on suicide risk following the
incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024. Staff
1 reported Youth A was locked in his bedroom for suicide
precaution by Staff 7. Staff 1 did not know how long Youth A was
in his bedroom on suicide precaution.
Staff 3 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024. Staff
3 reported Youth A was a harm to himself and others, so he was
placed in the suicide monitoring room, room 1, that has a camera.
Staff 3 reported Youth A was in room 1 and picked at the paint
which had a sharp edge that Youth A used to pick at an old scab.
Staff 3 reported it was determined Youth A would go on suicide
precaution however Staff 3 did not know who determined Youth A
needed to go on suicide precaution and would need to go into a
suicide gown.
Facility Manager was interviewed via teams on 10/24/2024.
Facility Manager reported she is supposed to know/be informed
when youth are placed in their bedrooms. Facility Manager
reported she started asking questions as to why Youth A was in
his bedroom and was informed, he was placed on suicide
precaution. Facility Manager reported she went to check on Youth
A and he was yelling in the bedroom and swearing however she
ensured he was safe. Facility Manager reported only safety
support coordinators and managers at the facility can make the
decision for a youth to go into seclusion in their bedrooms. Facility
Manager reported if she is not physically present during the
incident that she is to be notified immediately of the situation.
Facility Manager reported she was not notified of the incident as
she is supposed to be. Facility Manager did not recall how long
Youth A had been in his bedroom prior to her entering the pod and
finding him in his bedroom. Facility Manager reported Staff 4
placed Youth A on suicide precaution and Staff 4 is not approved
to place youth on suicide precaution. Facility Manager reported
the clinical case managers are supposed to be the individuals to
determine if suicide precaution is needed. Facility Manager
reported staff did not follow the policy and procedure for placing a
youth on suicide precaution and expressed that she did not think
the staff were aware that there was a procedure that needed to be
followed.
16

Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on 10/28/2024. Staff 7
reported Staff 4 told him Facility Manager said for Youth A to go
on suicide precaution. Staff 7 reported the manager on shift
determines if a youth needs to be placed on suicide precaution.
Staff 7 reported Facility Manager was on grounds during the
incident however was not on the pod. Staff 7 reported he thought
Facility Manager was watching the incident on the camera system
and directed Staff 4 to pass the information along that he was
going on suicide precaution. Staff 7 reported suicide precaution is
when a one-on-one is assigned to sit at the youth’s door to
complete checks on the youth every five minutes. Staff 7 reported
Youth A was on suicide precaution and was not allowed to come
out of his bedroom, however, did not know how long Youth A
remained in his bedroom. Youth are taken off suicide precaution
once they see the doctor and the doctor recommends the youth
comes off. Staff 7 reported he talked to Facility Manager that night
however did not recall if it was on the pod or in the office and he
was unable to recall what they discussed.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 9/30/2024 was unable to be reviewed as the
facility reported a power outage occurred resulting in the server
being knocked out and no video footage for the month of
September being able to be obtained to review.
Documents Reviewed:
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Use of Suicide
Precautions for Youth At Risk: The staff believing that a
youth is at risk for suicide or self-harm shall place the youth
under continuous direct observation and immediately notify
the facility manager. The facility manager will direct staff on
the level of precautions to use based on the Suicide
Precautions Initial Level Form. Per the facilities policy,
facility manager will evaluate the youth and select and
implement appropriate suicide preauction including
notifying the clinical services manager or the detention
systems manager who will notify the clinical case manager
or detention assessment worker.
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Suicide Precautions
Initial Level Form for Youth A dated 9/30/2024: Youth A
was placed on Level 3 during waking hours.
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Unusual Incident
Report Summary dated 9/30/2024 at 5:05pm for Youth A:
Staff 1 removed all Youth A’s clothing. Facility Manager
arrived on the scene and evaluated the situation and
contacted Medical Director Doctor and per his
17

recommendation Youth A was placed on Suicide
Precaution. Psychiatrist was contacted at 6:24pm, Medical
Director at 6:09pm, Chief Administrator at 6:04pm, and
Clinical Case Manager at 6:21pm.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as the facility did not follow
their internal policy and procedure as per interview with Facility
Manager, she was not immediately notified and only became
aware of Youth A being in his bedroom on suicide precaution due
to her entering the pod for unrelated reasons and finding Youth A
in his bedroom. Facility Manager reported Staff 3 placed Youth A
on suicide precaution and Staff 3 does not have the authority to
place youth on suicide precaution. The facility’s suicide precaution
policy indicates staff believing a youth is at risk for suicide or self -
harm shall immediately place the youth under continuous
observation and promptly notify the facility manager and shift
supervisor. Per the facility’s policy, facility manager will evaluate
the youth and select and implement appropriate suicide
preauction including notifying the clinical services manager or the
detention systems manager who will notify the clinical case
manager or detention assessment worker.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered to retrain all staff on suicide
precaution policy and procedure.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2024SIC0001229 dated 9/13/2024, CAP pending approval
Rule Code Seclusion within secure and nonsecure facilities; seclusion plan;
Title prohibitions; reduction and elimination
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4162
Section (11) All seclusion will be prohibited effective November 1, 2022.
Description
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Facility is secluding youth outside parameters of seclusion
variance.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/3/2024. Youth A reported he was placed on suicide precaution
and locked in his bedroom.
18

Staff 1 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024. Staff
1 reported Youth A was locked in his bedroom for suicide
precaution. Staff 1 did not know how long Youth A was in his
bedroom on suicide precaution.
Staff 2 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024. Staff
2 reported Youth A was placed on suicide precaution and placed
in a suicide gown.
Staff 3 was interviewed via teams meeting on 10/24/2024. Staff
3 reported Youth A was a harm to himself and others, so he was
placed in the suicide monitoring room, room 1, that has a camera.
Staff 3 reported Youth A was in room 1 and picked at the paint
which had a sharp edge that Youth A used to pick at an old scab.
Staff 3 reported it was determined Youth A would go on suicide
precaution and would need to go into a suicide gown.
Facility Manager was interviewed via teams on 10/24/2024.
Facility Manager reported she entered Youth A’s pod and found
Youth A was in his bedroom with the door closed and locked.
Facility Manager was informed Youth A was placed on suicide
precaution.
Staff 7 was interviewed via telephone on 10/28/2024. Staff 7
reported Youth A was placed on suicide precaution in his
bedroom.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on
10/28/2024. Chief Administrator reported suicide precaution is
used at the facility when a youth is trying to harm themself and it is
unknown to what extent the youth will go to self-harm. Chief
Administrator reported when a youth is on suicide precaution the
youth’s bedroom is strip of all items to ensure the youth is unable
to obtain any items to self-harm with and the youth is locked in
their bedroom and can’t come out. Chief Administrator reported
the youth may be let out to shower if the youth is locked in their
bedrooms for twenty-four to forty-eight hours. Chief Administrator
reported the Psychiatrist meets with the youth and once it is
determined by the Psychiatrist the youth is safe to be able to
come out of their bedroom, the youth is then let out. Chief
Administrator reported she was not contacted for Youth A being
secluded in his bedroom on 9/30/2024. Chief Administrator
reported per the facilities seclusion variance, administrator
approval for seclusion would mean herself, medical director,
clinical director, two clinical supervisors, and the Psychiatrist.
Chief Administrator reported suicide precaution is not seclusion.
19

The facility is locking youth in their bedrooms for suicide
precaution as it is part of the process/procedure that the facility
has always done. Chief Administrator reported the facility has
never been informed that youth cannot be locked in their
bedrooms while on suicide precaution.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 9/30/2024 was unable to be reviewed as the
facility reported a power outage occurred resulting in the server
being knocked out and no video footage for the month of
September being able to be obtained to review.
Documents Reviewed:
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Unusual Incident
Report Summary dated 9/30/2024 for Youth A indicated
Youth A was placed in their room for suicide precaution.
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Use of Suicide
Precautions for Youth at Risk: Appropriate precautions
shall be taken to prevent the suicide or self-harm of all
youth. The Facility Manager will evaluate the youth and
select and implement appropriate Suicide Precautions,
which will include the following: Assigning continuous staff
supervision of the youth to maintain the youth’s safety while
evaluation takes place. A selection of an appropriate
Precautions Level documented on an appropriate Suicide
Precautions Initial Level Form.
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Servies Use of Suicide
Precautions for Youth at Risk: Youth on higher Levels of
Precautions may be removed from their rooms for hygiene
and recreation if this can be done safely. When a youth is
on Level 2, 3, or 4 precautions is to be let out of his/her
room Staff will notify co-workers and the Shift Supervisor
prior to allowing the youth to leave his/her room for these
purposes. Level 3 – Youth confined to room with door
locked. Risk to staff from youth is evaluated as moderate or
greater. Youth to staff ratio not to exceed 4 youth to 1 staff.
• Variance approval letter to Calumet Center dated
9/27/2024 does not allow seclusion to be used for suicide
precaution.
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Suicide Precautions
Initial Level Form for Youth A dated 9/30/2024: Youth A
was placed on Level 3 during waking hours. Level 3- Youth
confined to room with door locked.
20

• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Suicide Precaution
Logging Form for Youth A dated 9/30/2024 at 6pm through
10/6/2024 at 5:45pm: Youth A had five-minute checks
completed on him from the time he went on suicide
precaution until he was taken off suicide precaution. It is
unclear on the form when Youth A was allowed out of his
bedroom. Spectrum juvenile Justice Services Suicide
Precautions Level Change form for Youth A dated
10/1/2024: Youth A was moved to level 1 during waking
hours: Level 1- Youth directly supervised by staff who
maintains continuous line of sight supervision within 10 feet
of the youth at all times while allowing the youth to
participate in scheduled daily activities.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as the facility secluded
Youth A in his bedroom on 9/30/2024 as Youth A was assessed to
be a suicide precaution level 3. Youth A remained locked in his
bedroom from approximately 9/30/2024 at 6pm through 10/1/2024
at 1:30pm when Youth A was reassessed and determined per the
suicide precaution level change form that he was a level 1. The
facility’s seclusion variance does not provide approval to seclude
youth for suicide precaution.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Health status assessment; notification; debriefing; reporting
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163
Section (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
Description by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility did not provide an incident report on a form prescribed
by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint.
Investigation Interviews:
Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on
10/28/2024. Chief Administrator reported the facility completes
their internal UIR (unusual incident report) for restraints and
seclusions. Chief Administrator reported if incident reports are
21

required to be completed in MiSACWIS then the facility needs to
be informed of that. Chief Administrator reported she did not
know what the facilities policy was regarding documenting
restraints and seclusion in MiSACWIS. Chief Administrator
reported she thought the facility manager was completing incident
reports in the system.
Operations Manager was interviewed via telephone on
10/28/2024. Operations Manager reported there are only a few
individuals at the facility that have MiSACWIS access however
was unsure who and who was responsible for completing incident
reports in MiSACWIS.
Documents Reviewed:
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Services Unusual Incident
Report Summary dated 9/30/2024 for Youth A indicated
Youth A was physically restrained and was placed in their
room for suicide precaution.
• Spectrum Juvenile Justice Servies Health Status
Assessment; Notification; Debriefing; Reporting Policy:
Incident involving restraint or seclusion will be entered into
MiSACWIS within 24 hours of the incident occurring. The
final report will be approved by the identified approver no
later than 72 hours after the incident occurred.
• MiSACWIS was checked on 10/8/2024 and there was no
incident report entered for Youth A being restrained or
placed in seclusion on 9/30/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Youth A was restrained
and placed in seclusion in his bedroom on 9/30/2024 and the
agency did not provide an incident report on a form prescribed by
the department.
Conclusion Violation Established
22

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
